alert.note: Alert for Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 28 at 1:55PM CDT until November 01 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. .Heavy rain from earlier in the week has led to a sharp river rise and flooding along the Yellow River at Necedah. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellow River at Necedah. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Wednesday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 15.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 PM CDT Saturday was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.8 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.6 feet on 04/23/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 145 AM CDT.
